column4: seveas lets not start a windows vs linux flame war. I actually got nothing against windows.
can someone tell me what the programs etherape and etherreal are for?
etherape shows you a diagram of which hosts are sending stuff to each other.  ethereal shows it in a table.
all over the place, wherever they belong.
you can "dpkg -L <packagename>" to see what it installed for any given package
he's forgotten his user's password - or someone's changed it for him
he thinks he needs another password called root.
we are telling him his usr accoutn is the root password.
if he does sudo he will be fine
but hes rude no point helping him.
I think he's being rude 'cos he's frustrated that everyone is answering a question that he didn't ask :)
i think someone did tell him that solution first and he said it was wrong so we told him another one.
boot into rescue mode and reset your password from there if it really has changed.
try typing it at the command prompt to see if it looks right
im not the one with the password problem he is.
you all look the same to me, you IRC nicks
